articles.author: David Shepardson
articles.description: The U.S. Federal Aviation Administration said on Wednesday night that a PSA Airlines regional jet collided midair with a Sikorsky H-60 helicopter while on approach to Reagan Washington National Airport.
articles.title: Regional jet collides with helicopter near Washington's Reagan Airport

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Militants from Hamas and allied groups Islamic Jihad and Popular Resistance Committees arrived at a site in Khan Younis in Gaza ahead of the handover of Israeli hostages on Thursday Hamas sources and witnesses said, as part of a ceasefire deal.
articles.title: Palestinian militants arrive at Gaza site before hostage handover, militant sources and witnesses say

articles.author: Sonia Rolley
articles.description: When M23 rebels swept into the Congolese city of Goma this week, world powers urged them to immediately withdraw. Instead, the Rwanda-backed insurgents are intent on showing they can restore order and govern.
articles.title: Having seized Goma, Congo's M23 rebels want to show they can govern

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Donald Trump's interest in buying Greenland is "not a joke," Secretary of State Marco Rubio said in an interview on Thursday, adding that acquiring Greenland was in U.S. national interest and needs to be solved.
articles.title: Trump interest in buying Greenland 'not a joke', Rubio says

articles.author: Phil Noble, Muvija M
articles.description: A Church of England bishop resigned on Thursday after what he called a "trial by media" over allegations of sexual assault which he has denied, but which have deepened a crisis at the mother church of the Anglican Communion.
articles.title: Church of England bishop resigns, denies sexual assault allegations

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Russian drone struck a multi-storey apartment building in the northeastern Ukrainian city of Sumy early on Thursday, killing nine people and injuring 13, including a child, President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said.
articles.title: Russian drone strikes apartment block in Ukraine, killing nine, Zelenskiy says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Syria's newly appointed president, Ahmed al-Sharaa, said on Thursday he will form an inclusive transitional government representing diverse communities that will build institutions and run the country until it can hold free and fair elections.
articles.title: Syrian leader Sharaa pledges to form inclusive government

articles.author: Jonathan Landay, Aram Roston
articles.description: A small U.S. security firm is hiring nearly 100 U.S. special forces veterans to help run a checkpoint in Gaza during the Israel-Hamas truce, introducing armed American contractors into the heart of one of the world's most violent conflict zones.
articles.title: Exclusive: Inside a US security firm's risky Gaza mission

articles.author: Elias Biryabarema
articles.description: Uganda has confirmed an outbreak of the Ebola virus in the capital Kampala with the first confirmed patient dying from it on Wednesday, the health ministry said on Thursday.
articles.title: Uganda confirms outbreak of Ebola in capital Kampala, one dead

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres on Thursday demanded that 2,500 children be immediately evacuated from Gaza for medical treatment after meeting with U.S. doctors who said the children were at imminent risk of death in the coming weeks.
articles.title: UN chief demands evacuation of 2,500 Gaza children at 'imminent risk' of death
